byline.contributor: Mariana Simões contributed reporting from Rio de Janeiro, and Jonathan Gilbert from Buenos Aires.

lead_paragraph: A case in which 14 senior sports officials and executives across the Americas have been charged offers a glimpse into the sort of deals that have long come under fire but have rarely led to a criminal proceeding.

headline.print_headline: A Region’s Strongmen Are Facing a Hard Fall
headline.main: A Region’s Soccer Strongmen Are Facing a Hard Fall

snippet: A case in which 14 senior sports officials and executives across the Americas have been charged offers a glimpse into the sort of deals that have long come under fire but have rarely led to a criminal proceeding.
abstract: Jose Maria Marin, former president of Brazilian Football Confederation, is one of 14 senior sports officials and executives charged by United States Justice Dept with taking part in sweeping bribery and kickback scheme within FIFA, governing body of global soccer.
